event.summary: 03/27/1993: In Cairo, a time bomb exploded as it was being examined by an explosives expert, killing one person and injuring seven other people. Al-Jama a al-Islamiyya (Islamic Group) may have been responsible for the attack.
event.motive: Militants had vowed revenge for the killing of 28 Islamists by government forces during the month.
event.addnotes: The officer killed was the 54th person to die in violence waged by militants, seeking to oust the government and create a religious state. This was the third bomb in a month in downtown Cairo. A member of Al-Jama a al-Islamiyya (Islamic Group) claimed responsibility for the attack, but it remained unclear as to whether or not the claim was valid.
event.scite1: “Police Expert Killed By Time bomb,” Press Association, March 27, 1993.
event.scite2: Dalia Baligh, “Time Bomb Explodes in Civil Defense Building; 1 Dead,” The Associated Press, March 27, 1993.
event.scite3: “Four policemen injured in time bomb explosion,” Xinhua, March 27, 1993
